page.title: 16Business in Rawdon
page.content: These range from a company with 350 employees making ventilation systems and a family-owned printing firm(est. 1904)with 165 making cardboard cartons,through many craft workshops, to self-employed people working from home.{Industrial development}is restricted in this green belt area,so most are housed in converted premises which were originally woollen mills,a chemical works,and a Quaker school. People regard it as a good place for a business,being {pleasantly rural}yet near the{airport,main roads}and{major {industrial centres}of Bradford and Leeds.Small businesses rent rooms in old buildings cheaply and near their homes.The largest firm bought an old mill 10 years ago and recently demolished it and erected an extensive new factory on the site which was opened by the Duchess of Kent in 1985.
